Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P5-CT3 (Lys-rich; Leu-rich; synthetic AMPs, UCLL1; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (87.71%) toP5-CT2K: 50%; L: 33%.  GRAVY: -0.89; M Wt: 1523.005; Mol formula: C76H136N19O13; molar extinction coeff: 5550.Activity: active against Gram-  P-aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC >25 uM), A-baumannii KCTC 2508 (MIC >25 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 3.13 uM), and B. subtilis KCTC 2217 (MIC 6.25 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus; ; MgCl2-insensitive:S. aureus. FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM). Provided by Arjun Nair.
Literature Information.Author: Kwon JY, Kim MK, Mereuta L, Seo CH, Luchian T, Park Y. 2019
Literature Information.Title: Mechanism of action of antimicrobial peptide P5 truncations against Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus.
